policies.name: Identification and Authentication Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing user identification and authentication requirements, including methods, re-authentication scenarios, and processes acting on behalf of users
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.01 requires 'uniquely identify and authenticate system users' and 're-authenticate users when circumstances require' which necessitates formal policy guidance on authentication methods and scenarios

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: High-level policy governing system access controls and user authorization
policies.rationale: Authentication is the foundation of access control; users must be authenticated before authorization can be applied

procedures.name: User Authentication Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for implementing and configuring authentication mechanisms including passwords, physical authenticators, and biometrics
procedures.rationale: Control requires organizations to use 'passwords, physical authenticators, biometrics, or some combination thereof' which needs detailed implementation guidance

procedures.name: Re-Authentication Procedure
procedures.description: Process for identifying circumstances requiring re-authentication and enforcing re-authentication for role changes, credential changes, privileged functions, time periods
procedures.rationale: Control specifies 're-authenticate users when circumstances require' including 'when roles, authenticators, or credentials change; when execution of privileged functions occurs; after fixed time period; or periodically'

procedures.name: Process Authentication Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for associating unique user identification with system processes acting on behalf of users
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'associate that unique identification with processes acting on behalf of those users' which needs specific implementation steps

executionEvidence.name: Authentication Log Reports
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: user identifier, authentication method used, timestamp, source IP/device, success/failure status, processes initiated by authenticated user
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control requiring continuous monitoring of authentication events; NIST requires 'authentication of users apply to all system accesses'

executionEvidence.name: Re-Authentication Audit Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: privileged function invocations, re-authentication events, user identifier, timestamp, function accessed, authentication method used for re-authentication
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with re-authentication requirements for privileged operations and role changes specified in control

executionEvidence.name: User-to-Process Association Reports
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: active user sessions, processes running under each user context, unique user identifiers associated with processes, timestamp of association
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies control requirement to 'associate unique identification with processes acting on behalf of users' for accountability

executionEvidence.name: Authentication Mechanism Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Current configuration of authentication systems showing: enabled authentication methods, password policies, biometric settings, multi-factor configurations, re-authentication triggers
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates proper implementation and maintenance of authentication mechanisms required by control

operationalActivities: Authenticate all users before granting system access
Associate unique user identifiers with all processes acting on behalf of users
Re-authenticate users when roles or credentials change
Re-authenticate users before executing privileged functions
Enforce periodic re-authentication based on defined time periods
Monitor authentication logs for suspicious activity
Review and update authentication mechanism configurations

policies.name: Device Authentication Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining which devices and device types require authentication before system connection, including organization-owned and non-owned devices
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.02 requires 'uniquely identify and authenticate organization-defined devices or types of devices' which necessitates policy defining device scope and requirements

policies.name: Network Access Control Policy
policies.description: Policy governing network access requirements including device authentication standards
policies.rationale: Control requires authentication 'before establishing a system connection' which is enforced through network access controls

procedures.name: Device Registration and Authentication Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for registering devices, issuing device credentials, configuring device authentication (802.1x, EAP, certificates), and maintaining device inventory
procedures.rationale: Control requires implementation of 'organizational authentication solutions (e.g., IEEE 802.1x and EAP, RADIUS server with EAP-TLS authentication, Kerberos)'

procedures.name: Certificate Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for issuing, renewing, and revoking device certificates used in PKI-based device authentication
procedures.rationale: Control discussion states 'Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and certificate revocation checking for the certificates exchanged can be included as part of device authentication'

procedures.name: MAC Address Management Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for managing and validating device MAC addresses used for device identification
procedures.rationale: Control states systems use 'shared known information (e.g., Media Access Control [MAC], TCP/IP addresses) for device identification'

executionEvidence.name: Device Inventory with Authentication Status
executionEvidence.description: Inventory showing: device name/identifier, device type, MAC address, authentication method configured, certificate status (if applicable), connection authorization status, last authentication date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates organization has identified and classified devices requiring authentication per control requirement

executionEvidence.name: Device Authentication Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: device identifier (MAC/certificate), authentication timestamp, authentication method used (802.1x, EAP, etc.), success/failure status, network segment accessed
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control requiring monitoring that devices are authenticated before connection; NIST requires authentication 'before establishing a system connection'

executionEvidence.name: Certificate Issuance and Revocation Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: device certificates issued, issuance date, expiration date, certificates revoked, revocation date and reason, certificate serial numbers
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates PKI-based device authentication is properly managed per control discussion on certificate revocation checking

executionEvidence.name: Network Access Control (NAC) Configuration Reports
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: NAC policies configured, device authentication requirements by network segment, 802.1x/EAP settings, RADIUS server configuration, authentication enforcement status
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies device authentication mechanisms are properly configured per control requirement

operationalActivities: Maintain inventory of devices requiring authentication
Register devices and issue authentication credentials
Configure network access controls to enforce device authentication
Monitor device authentication attempts and failures
Issue and manage device certificates for PKI authentication
Revoke device credentials when devices are decommissioned or compromised
Review and update device authentication policies quarterly

policies.name: Multi-Factor Authentication Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy mandating MFA for privileged and non-privileged account access, defining acceptable authentication factors (something you know, have, are)
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.03 requires 'implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts' which necessitates formal policy defining MFA requirements

policies.name: Privileged Access Management Policy
policies.description: Policy governing access to privileged accounts and administrative functions
policies.rationale: Control explicitly requires MFA 'for access to privileged accounts' which needs privileged access policy context

procedures.name: MFA Enrollment Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for enrolling users in MFA, registering authentication factors (hardware tokens, biometrics, smart cards), and verifying factor ownership
procedures.rationale: Control requires implementation using 'two or more different factors' including 'something you know (PIN), something you have (physical authenticator), or something you are (biometric)'

procedures.name: MFA Authenticator Distribution and Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for distributing physical authenticators (hardware tokens, smart cards), tracking assigned authenticators, handling lost/stolen authenticators, and deactivating authenticators
procedures.rationale: Control discussion mentions 'hardware authenticators that provide time-based or challenge-response outputs and smart cards' requiring management procedures

procedures.name: MFA Bypass/Exception Procedure
procedures.description: Process for requesting, approving, and documenting temporary MFA exceptions or alternative authentication methods in emergency situations
procedures.rationale: Operational need for controlled exceptions while maintaining security; exceptions must be documented and approved

executionEvidence.name: MFA Enrollment Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: user identifier, enrollment date, authentication factors registered (types), authenticator serial numbers (if applicable), enrollment verification method, enrollment status
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates all users have MFA configured per control requirement; critical control requiring up-to-date enrollment tracking

executionEvidence.name: MFA Authentication Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: user identifier, authentication timestamp, factors used in authentication, success/failure status, account type (privileged/non-privileged), system accessed
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control verifying MFA is enforced for all account access; NIST requires MFA 'for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts'

executionEvidence.name: MFA Coverage Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: total accounts (privileged vs non-privileged), accounts with MFA enabled, accounts without MFA (with justification), MFA compliance percentage, gaps identified
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates comprehensive MFA implementation across all account types as required by control

executionEvidence.name: Physical Authenticator Inventory
executionEvidence.description: Inventory showing: authenticator type (hardware token, smart card), serial number, assigned user, distribution date, status (active/deactivated), return date (if applicable)
executionEvidence.rationale: Tracks physical authenticators mentioned in control discussion including 'hardware authenticators' and 'smart cards'

executionEvidence.name: MFA Exception Approval Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: exception request details, requestor, business justification, approver, approval date, exception duration, compensating controls, expiration date
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents any temporary deviations from MFA requirements with proper authorization and compensating controls

operationalActivities: Enroll all users in multi-factor authentication
Distribute and track physical authenticators (tokens, smart cards)
Enforce MFA for all privileged account access
Enforce MFA for all non-privileged account access
Monitor MFA authentication attempts and failures
Handle lost or stolen authenticator incidents
Deactivate authenticators for terminated users
Review MFA coverage and compliance monthly
Process and approve MFA exception requests with compensating controls

policies.name: Authentication Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy requiring replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for privileged and non-privileged accounts
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.04 requires 'implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms' which necessitates policy defining replay resistance requirements

policies.name: Cryptographic Standards Policy
policies.description: Policy defining approved cryptographic protocols and mechanisms including nonces, challenges, and time-synchronous authentication
policies.rationale: Control discussion states 'replay-resistant techniques include protocols that use nonces or challenges, such as time synchronous or challenge-response one-time authenticators'

procedures.name: Replay-Resistant Authentication Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for configuring and implementing replay-resistant protocols (Kerberos, challenge-response, time-based tokens)
procedures.rationale: Control requires implementation of authentication that resists replay attacks where 'it is impractical to successfully authenticate by recording or replaying previous authentication messages'

procedures.name: One-Time Authenticator Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Process for implementing and managing one-time passwords, time-synchronous tokens, and challenge-response systems
procedures.rationale: Control discussion specifies 'time synchronous or challenge-response one-time authenticators' as replay-resistant techniques

procedures.name: Nonce and Challenge Generation Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for implementing cryptographic nonces and challenges in authentication protocols
procedures.rationale: Control states 'replay-resistant techniques include protocols that use nonces or challenges' requiring proper implementation

executionEvidence.name: Authentication Protocol Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: authentication protocols enabled (Kerberos, RADIUS, etc.), replay resistance mechanisms configured (nonces, timestamps, challenges), protocol versions, cryptographic algorithms used, configuration parameters
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates replay-resistant authentication is properly configured per control requirement

executionEvidence.name: Replay-Resistant Authentication Test Results
executionEvidence.description: Test reports showing: replay attack simulation results, protocol vulnerability assessments, nonce/challenge effectiveness validation, time-synchronization verification, test date and methodology
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies replay resistance is effective; control requires authentication that makes it 'impractical to successfully authenticate by recording or replaying previous messages'

executionEvidence.name: Authentication Token/Challenge Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: nonce/challenge generation, token usage timestamps, one-time password consumption, replay attempt detection, user identifier, authentication success/failure
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control requiring monitoring that replay-resistant mechanisms are functioning properly

executionEvidence.name: Time Synchronization Compliance Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems with time-synchronous authentication, time source configuration, time drift measurements, synchronization status, last sync timestamp
executionEvidence.rationale: Time-synchronous authentication requires accurate time sync; control discussion mentions 'time synchronous...one-time authenticators'

operationalActivities: Configure authentication systems to use replay-resistant protocols
Implement nonce or challenge-response mechanisms
Deploy time-synchronous one-time authenticators
Monitor authentication logs for replay attempts
Test replay resistance of authentication systems
Maintain time synchronization for time-based authenticators
Review and update replay-resistant authentication configurations
Validate cryptographic protocols remain current and secure

policies.name: Identifier Management Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing assignment, management, and lifecycle of user, group, role, service, and device identifiers including reuse prevention and status tracking
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.05 requires 'manage system identifiers' through authorization, selection, assignment, reuse prevention, and archival processes requiring formal policy guidance

policies.name: Account Management Policy
policies.description: Policy governing user account lifecycle including identifier assignment and deactivation
policies.rationale: Identifier management is integral to account management; control requires authorization, assignment, and archival of identifiers

procedures.name: Identifier Assignment and Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for requesting identifier assignment authorization, selecting appropriate identifiers, and assigning identifiers to individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'receive authorization from organizational personnel or roles to assign identifier' and 'select and assign identifier that identifies individual, group, role, service, or device'

procedures.name: Identifier Reuse Prevention Procedure
procedures.description: Process for tracking previously used identifiers, enforcing reuse waiting period, and preventing reassignment of identifiers during defined time period
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'prevent reuse of identifiers for organization-defined time period' and states 'prohibiting reuse prevents assignment of previously used identifiers to different entities'

procedures.name: Identifier Status Management Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for tracking and identifying individual status characteristics (contractor, foreign national, non-organizational user) and updating identifier records
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as organization-defined characteristic identifying individual status'

procedures.name: Identifier Archival Procedure
procedures.description: Process for archiving user identifiers when individuals are no longer associated with organization to support accountability
procedures.rationale: Control requires archival 'to support accountability when individuals that possess those identifiers are no longer associated with the organization'

executionEvidence.name: Identifier Assignment Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: identifier requested, intended recipient (individual/group/role/service/device), authorizing personnel/role, authorization date, justification, identifier assigned, assignment date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates control requirement 'receive authorization from organizational personnel or roles to assign identifier' is followed

executionEvidence.name: Identifier Lifecycle Audit Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: identifier created, creation date, assigned entity, identifier status changes, reassignment events (if any), archival date, associated characteristics (contractor, foreign national)
executionEvidence.rationale: Tracks complete identifier lifecycle from creation through archival as required by control

executionEvidence.name: Identifier Reuse Prevention Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: archived identifiers, original assignment date, deactivation date, earliest reuse-eligible date based on defined waiting period, reuse requests denied, current status
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies control requirement to 'prevent reuse of identifiers for organization-defined time period' is enforced

executionEvidence.name: User Status Classification Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: user identifier, individual status (employee, contractor, foreign national, non-organizational user), status assignment date, status change history, current authorization level
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with requirement to 'manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as characteristic identifying individual status'

executionEvidence.name: Identifier Archive Repository
executionEvidence.description: Database/repository containing: archived identifiers, original owner information, assignment history, archival date, archival reason, accountability linkage to past actions
executionEvidence.rationale: Fulfills control requirement to archive identifiers 'to support accountability' when individuals leave organization

operationalActivities: Request and obtain authorization before assigning identifiers
Select and assign unique identifiers for individuals, groups, roles, services, and devices
Track identifier assignments and lifecycle status
Enforce identifier reuse prevention waiting periods
Classify and track user status characteristics (contractor, foreign national, etc.)
Archive identifiers when individuals leave organization
Review identifier management processes quarterly
Maintain accountability linkage between archived identifiers and past actions

policies.name: Password Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining password requirements including composition rules, complexity, length, commonly-used password restrictions, transmission security, and storage requirements
policies.rationale: NIST 03.05.07 requires comprehensive password management including composition rules, compromised password lists, cryptographic protection, requiring formal policy guidance

policies.name: Authenticator Protection Policy
policies.description: Policy governing protection and secure handling of all authentication credentials
policies.rationale: Control requires multiple protection mechanisms for passwords including cryptographic protection, secure transmission, and list maintenance

procedures.name: Password Composition and Complexity Enforcement Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for configuring password complexity rules, minimum length requirements, and enforcing composition standards based on organizational requirements
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'enforce the following composition and complexity rules for passwords: organization-defined composition and complexity rules'

procedures.name: Compromised Password List Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for maintaining, updating, and checking passwords against list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords from breach corpuses, dictionaries, and sequential patterns
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'maintain list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords' and 'update the list organization-defined frequency and when passwords suspected compromised'

procedures.name: Password Validation and Rejection Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for automatically checking new/changed passwords against compromised password list and rejecting prohibited passwords during account creation or password change
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'verify that passwords are not found on list of commonly used, expected, or compromised passwords when users create or update passwords'

procedures.name: Password Storage and Transmission Security Procedure
procedures.description: Process for implementing cryptographic protection for stored passwords (salted hashing) and requiring encrypted channels for password transmission
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'transmit passwords only over cryptographically protected channels' and 'store passwords in cryptographically protected form' including 'salted one-way cryptographic hashes'

procedures.name: Account Recovery Password Reset Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure for secure account recovery requiring new password selection upon first use after recovery
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'select new password upon first use after account recovery' to ensure strength implemented at earliest opportunity

executionEvidence.name: Compromised Password List Update Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: list update date, number of passwords added, sources used (breach corpuses, dictionaries, organizational context), current list size, update frequency compliance
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates control requirement to 'maintain list' and 'update the list organization-defined frequency and when passwords suspected compromised'

executionEvidence.name: Password Validation Rejection Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: password change attempts, passwords rejected (hashed), rejection reason (on compromised list, weak, dictionary word), user identifier, timestamp, successful compliance
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies control requirement to 'verify passwords are not found on list when users create or update passwords' is enforced

executionEvidence.name: Password Storage Encryption Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems storing passwords, hashing algorithm used (bcrypt, PBKDF2, Argon2), salt implementation confirmed, plaintext password absence verified, last verification date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates control requirement to 'store passwords in cryptographically protected form' using 'salted one-way cryptographic hashes'

executionEvidence.name: Password Transmission Security Audit Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: password transmission events, encryption protocol used (TLS version), cipher suite, certificate validation, unencrypted transmission attempts blocked, timestamp
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control verifying 'transmit passwords only over cryptographically protected channels' is enforced

executionEvidence.name: Password Complexity Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: minimum length requirements, composition rules enforced (character types), complexity settings, implementation across all systems, configuration review date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates control requirement to 'enforce composition and complexity rules for passwords' is properly configured

executionEvidence.name: Account Recovery Password Change Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: account recovery events, temporary password issued, first-use password change timestamp, user identifier, verification that new password meets requirements
executionEvidence.rationale: Verifies control requirement to 'select new password upon first use after account recovery' ensuring 'strength implemented at earliest opportunity'

operationalActivities: Maintain and update list of compromised passwords from breach corpuses and dictionaries
Update compromised password list at defined frequency and when breaches occur
Automatically validate passwords against compromised list during creation/change
Reject passwords found on compromised list
Enforce password complexity and composition rules
Store all passwords using salted cryptographic hashing (never plaintext)
Require password transmission only over encrypted channels (TLS)
Force password change upon first use after account recovery
Review password management configurations quarterly
Audit password storage and transmission security regularly
